channel.title: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command
channel.description: I coded my own P-Server, but I had to get a new computer, and now when i open my client it says: "Java is not recognized as an internal or external command" People say to change Java's path, i know how to get to the place to change it, but not what to change it, PLEASE HELP! :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad:

item.title: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

try this compiler! @echo off :menu title StabbingScape compiler @echo Compiling..... if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Compiling Finished. pause exit

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command

item.title: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @allisgood888 allisgood888
item.description:
@allisgood888 wrote:

I did that and it says it cant find javaw but i typed java not javaw, and quote is not recognized as an internal or external command. HELP

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command

item.title: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Bigbucks Mod Bigbucks
item.description:
@Mod_Bigbucks wrote:

Go to start, Hover over “Computer” (My Computer in XP), then right click and click “Properties”. Go to “Advanced System Settings”. Under the “Advanced” Tab, click “Environmental Variables”. Create a New on under “User Variables” NOT “System Variables”. For variable name put “PATH” and variable value “(location to jre);(Location to jdk);”. Obviously changing to match where you installed them to. For me it is “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin;”. Ask if you have any more questions.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is not recognized as an internal or external command
